5. The addition of "eating junk food" to the original premise introduces a factor that could potentially counteract the weight loss effects of exercise.

6. The original statement doesn't claim that exercise is the only factor in weight loss or that it will lead to weight loss regardless of other factors.

7. Therefore, we cannot logically infer that the weight loss effect of exercise will still occur when combined with eating junk food, as this new condition could potentially negate or reduce the effect of exercise on weight loss.
